body:
If you open a Dart file, and the Dart plugin is not installed, you get a notification inviting you to install Dart.  We should do the same for Flutter when a Flutter Module is encountered but the Flutter plugin is not installed.

@alexander-doroshko: curious where this logic gets contributed?

comment_data.body: JetBrains plugin repository is scanned for plugins that declare `FileType`s. Unfortunately not applicable for Flutter plugin.
Ah.  That makes sense.  I suppose we could add something to the Dart plugin if we really wanted but not sure how weird that would be (and would create a kind of bidirectional dependency besides).
Yes! Was just going to file this issue. :)
It's not commonly opened, but perhaps we could register for the flutter.yaml file?

Hm, so it's only triggered to prompt a plugin if the user opens a file? Bummer we can't prompt for a plugin when the user imports a new project.

Could we prompt for the Flutter plugin if they open a .dart file with an import to 'package:flutter' or 'dart:ui' ?

Ah!  I tried to answer this over on #364.  We totally could do something like that in the Dart plugin or maybe elsewhere?

@alexander-doroshko how does framework detection like Android work?  Can we do more than attach to an editor notification?

> so it's only triggered to prompt a plugin if the user opens a file?

No, just the presence of a file in a project is enough, but it won't work for Flutter, see below

> perhaps we could register for the flutter.yaml file?

'flutter.yaml' is a file name, not a file type, you can't register for it. There are no flutter-specific file types.

> how does framework detection like Android work?

It is `FrameworkDetector` class + extension point. In theory it could be used instead of editor notification that suggests to change module type to flutter and reload project. But I'm not sure it is better.
So if we have a .flutter file in the project, that would work? You need a unique file extension?

Sounds like the user would need to open that file type.

All flutter projects should now be created with the correct IntelliJ metadata. This includes a module file with the flutter module type.

I wonder if we could extend the platform to let plugins register as handlers for specific module types? Then if could say something like "you've opened a flutter project; would you like to install the flutter plugin?"

> Sounds like the user would need to open that file type.

ah, gotcha

> All flutter projects should now be created with the correct IntelliJ metadata.

Should we add that to the Gallery?
It's there now, and for the hello_world app as well. It's the .iml file in the directory (on mobile, but I think that's the file extension).
Please do not implement dirty hacks like registering *.flutter file type :)

> let plugins register as handlers for specific module types?

Your plugin already does  register module type. If user opens confgured Flutter project without Flutter plugin installed he gets a warning that FLUTTER_MODULE_TYPE is unknown.

> Your plugin already does register module type. If user opens confgured Flutter project without Flutter plugin installed he gets a warning that FLUTTER_MODULE_TYPE is unknown.

Right but wouldn't it be even cooler if the platform said, "It looks like you're trying to edit a Flutter module but you don't have the Flutter plugin, would you like to install it?"

Current status is you get this dialog if you File->Open a Flutter project (such as `/flutter/examples/hello_world/`) without having the Flutter plugin installed:
![screen shot 2016-12-08 at 09 57 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13644170/21003655/e1f79104-bd2c-11e6-9a1e-dda5c5841177.png)

If you click 'Configure plugins' you do get the Flutter plugin suggested.

@alexander-doroshko the text here seems a bit confusing, and I missed at first that it had a concrete suggestion for me. Can we say something like this?

- "Unknown feature (<feature>) detected. This is supported by the non-bundled plugin 'Flutter'. Click 'Configure plugins' to install it"?
Feel free to submit an issue or a pull request to https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/. The latter has better chances to be addressed quickly.
PR submitted: https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/pull/496
Nice! üëç
Very cool!
PR was merged!
Awesome!

milestone.description: Issues under consideration for upcoming milestones.
milestone.title: On Deck

title: Add notification to install Flutter when it's not
